intro: Henningia giselae, commonly known as the Giselae's henningia, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
